intro: Plectritis jepsonii, commonly known as Jepson's pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces white to pale yellow flowers with a distinctive pearly appearance. Plectritis jepsonii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
